Description: Pottery double jar decorated with images of the god Bes. The lower section consists of a wide-mounted jar with a ring-base, with a representation of Bes on one side showing facial details and the arms. Set into the mouth of this vessel, with the clay continuing in one piece, is the upper part of the object, consisting of a second vase with another Bes image on the side. The top of this part converged to a narrow mouth and rim, which has been broken off. Pale pink silt pottery, the lower section with a red exterior wash.
Curator's comments: For a parallel from Naukratis, see Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 86.387. Published in: Schlotzhauer, U. and S. Weber, Griechische Keramik des 7. und 6. Jahrhunderts v. Chr. aus Naukratis und anderen Orten in Ägypten, Archäologische Studien zu Naukratis III (Worms, 2012), Taf. 39b-c.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.059)
Condition: Good. Incomplete, top of rim lost. Some cracks.
